coding_practice.title: Factorial Trailing Zeroes
coding_practice.description:
Given an integer n, return the number of trailing zeroes in n!. 

Note that n! = n * (n - 1) * (n - 2) * ... * 3 * 2 * 1.
coding_practice.follow up: Could you write a solution that works in logarithmic time complexity?
coding_practice.explanation:
1. Trailing zeros in n! come from factors of 10, which are made from pairs of 2 and 5.
2. There are always more 2s than 5s, so count the number of 5s in the factorial decomposition.
3. Divide n by 5 repeatedly and sum the quotients to count all multiples of 5, 25, 125, etc.
